result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CRYSTAL R MARTIN

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant CRYSTAL R MARTIN in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for CRYSTAL R MARTIN on 2021CF180. Attorney Scott Nelson in court for Crystal R. Martin on 2022CF108  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by ADA - an offer was extended to Atty Kapelis on 2021CF180. Atty Kapelis concurs. Statement by Atty Kapelis. Court sets for Plea & sentencing on November 14, 2022 at 8:30 AM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
8:37 AM Defendant CRYSTAL R MARTIN in court.  Attorney William Scott Nelson in court for CRYSTAL R MARTIN.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Nelson states the defendant requests the prelim to proceed..

Taylor Wallace sworn, direct by ADA McElroy, is employed as a Patrol Deputy for Green lake County Sheriff's Department. Was employed in the date in question. Venue established. Testimony given. Identified the defendant present in court. Cross exam by Atty Nelson. ADA McElroy requests the court take judicial note of 2021CF180. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint. Attorney Nelson waives any reading. Atty Nelson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Court adjourned at 8:50 AM

Court will set for Status Hearing on October 25, 2022 at 1:30 PM.
Status hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant CRYSTAL R MARTIN in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states the defendant is requesting a preliminary hearing on 2022CF108. Court sets for Preliminary Hearing on September 6, 2022 at 8:30 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:15 AM Defendant CRYSTAL R MARTIN in court.  Attorney Michael Kapelis in court with the defendant. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint, waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA makes bond recommendation. Court notes bond has been set. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Prelim on July 26, 2022 at 3:15 pm. Other case to track with. 

Court adjourned at 11:17 AM
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on July 26, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant in custody and present in court via zoom. Attorney Matthew McElroy present in court via zoom. ADA Mcelroy makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 cash bond and condition of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Initial Appearance on June 21, 2022 at 11:00 AM
